newsitem.title: HUNGARY: Tesco unit bid to buy out Hungary's Global.
newsitem.headline: Tesco unit bid to buy out Hungary's Global.

text.p: Tesco's subsidiary Cheshunt Overseas Finance B.V., majority owner of Hungarian retailer Global T.H., on Monday made a buyout offer for holders of Global shares at 2,100 forints or 7.48 pounds.
The bid is valid between March 24 and May 12, 1997, and between January 5 and February 27, 1998, a Global advertisement in Monday's Hungarian daily Magyar Hirlap, said.
Global's annual shareholders' meeting on April 25 will consider a proposal to delist Global stocks from the Budapest Stock Exchange.
On the Budapest Stock Exchange, Global shares ended on Monday at 2,000 forints, up 200.
